Interface SimList<E>

All Known Implementing Classes:
ItemList
public interface SimList<E>
Gives the general contract for a list used in this simulation.
Version:
05/01/2024
Author:
Jackson Eshbaugh

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(int index, E e)
    Adds the element to the list at the specified index, moving elements further in the array.
    void
    add(E e)
    Adds the element to the list, resizing the array if need be.
    void
    clear()
    Clears the list and returns it to its initial state.
    E
    get(int index)
    Gets the list element at the specifed index.
    boolean
    isEmpty()
    Checks if there are any elements in the list (i.e., if the list's size is > 0).
    E
    remove(int index)
    Removes the list element at the specified location, and adjusts the position of surrounding elements.
    int
    size()
    Gets the size of the list.

  • Method Details

    • add

      void add(E e)
      Adds the element to the list, resizing the array if need be.
      Parameters:
      e - the element to add to the list

    • add

      void add(int index, E e)
      Adds the element to the list at the specified index, moving elements further in the array. Resizes the array if need be.
      Parameters:
      index - the index in the list to add the element to
      e - the element to add to the list

    • get

      E get(int index)
      Gets the list element at the specifed index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index from which to retrieve an element
      Returns:
      the element at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - when the index is not in the boundary of [0, size() -1].

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears the list and returns it to its initial state.

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if there are any elements in the list (i.e., if the list's size is > 0).
      Returns:
      true if the list is empty, and false if it has at least one element

    • remove

      E remove(int index)
      Removes the list element at the specified location, and adjusts the position of surrounding elements.
      Returns:
      the list element that is removed

    • size

      int size()
      Gets the size of the list.
      Returns:
      the size of the list
